wikipedia_page.main: James Bumphrey (4 May 1884 – 20 January 1946), also known as Jim Bumphrey, was an English professional footballer who played 136 games and scored 7 goals in the Football League for Birmingham. He began his career as a forward, but most of his league football was played as a half back, primarily at left half.

response: Smith was born in Kilnhurst, Yorkshire. A coal miner by trade, he began his football career with his works team, Hickleton Main Colliery, before joining Birmingham in 1912. He made his debut in the Second Division on 4 January 1913, deputising for James Bumphrey in an away game against Wolverhampton Wanderers which finished 2–2.Matthews, p. 159. A defensive player, described as one who "held his opponents in check effectively, but should show more discretion putting the ball forward", he was unable to impose himself on the first team, and after two seasons in which he played only eight games, he joined Chesterfield Town. Smith spent the 1914–15 season at the Midland League club, scoring once from 30 league games, before competitive football was suspended for the duration of the First World War.
